items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the api member of the webextensions Web Extensions interface. This sets the feature(s) to a version range based upon the date that the feature was added to BCD with the intent of replacing true values with ranged values to eliminate true values from BCD.

Commit/PR Adding the Feature: #166
items.title: Update Chromium data for webextensions.api

items.content_html:
Summary

This seems to be a non-feature.

Test results and supporting details

I could find no reference to it in a current spec, no open Chromium bugs relating to it, and failed to find evidence of it under inspection in Chrome with the flag turned on.

Related issues

The docs were removed from MDN in 2022: mdn/content#17743.

The data for this property probably ought to have been removed alongside #8442.
items.title: Remove `api.MouseEvent.region`

items.title: 33994 basic at scope

items.content_html:
Summary

Update the KeyboardEvent.repeat data for Chrome since as described in #23432 (and https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40940886) the implementation is broken, and can't really be used.

This needs to be updated, so web devs don't waste time on an implementation that cannot work due to well known browser bugs.

Test results and supporting details

As described in the linked issue (and upstream bug), I've created a JSFiddle that shows the issue:

  1. See this simple JSFiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/ys6o5tfg/5/
  2. Press and hold: ArrowLeft, ArrowUp, ArrowRight (in this order)
  3. Release ArrowRight (while keeping ArrowUp and ArrowRight pressed)
  4. See that KEYDOWN ArrowRight is printed in the div (i.e. a keydown event with repeat = false is emitted for ArrowRight)

Related issues

Fixes #23432
items.title: Update KeyboardEvent.repeat data for Chrome which has a bogus implementation

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Chrome and Safari for the mixed-content HTTP feature. This PR was intended to be a part of the true->ranged project with ranges based upon the commit the feature was added in, but the feature was first added to BCD this year (#23220), so this gives the roughest guess based upon all the sibling data.
items.title: Update Chrome/Safari data for mixed-content HTTP feature

items.content_html:
This PR is a draft of what it would look like to add Bun and its data to BCD, if we desired to do so. This draft is meant to be a proof of concept only for #18484.

Releases are obtained from Bun's GitHub repository. Compatibility data is obtained from unjs/runtime-compat.
items.title: Add Bun to BCD

items.content_html: This updates the compat data for Safari Web Extensions in Safari 18, and fixes older info for previous releases.
items.title: Update web extension compat data for Safari 18 and older releases

items.content_html:
This PR replaces true values with ranged values for all browsers for the HTTP headers, based upon the commits that added the features to BCD, or from applicable notes/other data.

Note: a lot of these were probably supported from the very beginning, but I opted to stick with these ranges instead of assuming, to balance both accuracy and quick version number addition. This will allow us to refine the version numbers later on and ensure complete accuracy.
items.title: Add ranged values to HTTP headers by commits

items.content_html:

items.content_html:
Summary

The WebCodecs API has been documented for a while, but some features are missing:

  • the AudioEncoderConfig.bitrateMode property. This was added to Chrome in v119 — developer.chrome.com/blog/chrome-119-beta#webcodecs_audioencoder_bitratemode
  • the AudioEncoderConfig.opus property and the OpusEncoderConfig dictionary. The application and signal properties were added in Chrome 126 (https://developer.chrome.com/blog/chrome-126-beta#opusencoderconfig_signal_and_application_parameters), but I need to find out when the opus property and dictionary as a whole were first added.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add BCD for bitrateMode, opus, and opus config features

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds browser compatibility data in support of Bug 1894128
[DNR] Replace MAX_NUMBER_OF_DYNAMIC_AND_SESSION_RULES including:

  • adding a note that MAX_NUMBER_OF_DYNAMIC_AND_SESSION_RULES was deprecated in Firefox 128 (I haven't marked the entire property as deprecated given that Safari hasn't yet made any updates)
  • MAX_NUMBER_OF_DYNAMIC_RULES and MAX_NUMBER_OF_SESSION_RULES - new entries, including documentation links (Chrome release number determined from https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/eab7fc99e59b69e929d02e43bdcf8bbd75333869/chrome/VERSION)
  • MAX_NUMBER_OF_UNSAFE_DYNAMIC_RULES and MAX_NUMBER_OF_UNSAFE_SESSION_RULES - new entries, excluding documentation links as these haven't been been implemented in Firefox yet (to be implemented in bug 1894119)

Related issues

Related changes to MDN content in mdn/content#34214
items.title: DNR properties changes

items.content_html:
Summary

The Async Clipboard API now supports SVG and custom web formats, in Chromium.

Support for these optional types was documented in BCD in #23134, but I think the chromium versions are incorrect. This PR updates the version numbers based on my findings.

Test results and supporting details

  • SVG

    SVG support was added in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5287618 which seems to be 124 according to https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/7380b9043440b808cff97d11f0eb08f704509389.

    This confirms the chromestatus.com entry: https://chromestatus.com/feature/5125790490427392

    So, I think BCD needs to be changed to 124 for both desktop and Android.

  • Custom web formats

    Support was added in https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40123727, which covers multiple commits, but the main one (313b28c002f1e552aa5b46094aae405f0fcb456b: "[Clipboard API] Enable Clipboard Web Custom Format API") landed in 104: https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/313b28c002f1e552aa5b46094aae405f0fcb456b

    This is confirmed by the chromestatus.com entry: https://chromestatus.com/feature/5649558757441536
items.title: Updating chromium support for optional data types in the Async Clipboard API

Fixes #20853

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
